Defendant involved in a case of alien smuggling as a juvenile, unsuccessfully discharged from the Center for not complying with requirements, with a history of delinquent conduct and substance abuse, attending school and receiving services while at the Webb County Jail, pled true to violating a condition of probation, argued that the juvenile court abused its discretion, appealed the juvenile court's order committing him to the TJJD
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Pryscilla Castillo: Probation officer who testified against J.M.E. regarding his unsuccessful discharge, failure to complete court-ordered services, and history of substance abuse, recommending placement at the TJJD for rehabilitation, provided testimony on less restrictive alternatives
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Beth Watkins: Justice presiding over the appeal of J.M.E.'s case
